data.title: Blake Lynch - Football
data.meta_description: Blake Lynch (2) Linebacker  - One of the most multi-talented players in the country ... 2019 All-Big 12 honorable mention ... Made 32 career starts at five different
data.text:
One of the most multi-talented players in the country ... 2019 All-Big 12 honorable mention ... Made 32 career starts at five different positions (corner, linebacker, safety, wide receiver, running back) ... started all 14 games in 2019 at SLB ... started at safety once and linebacker nine times in 2018 ... played both corner and wide receiver in 2017, making starts at both positions ... Saw action at both running back and receiver in 2016 ... has also seen game action at wildcat quarterback in his career ... 2019 Preseason All-Big 12 second team selection (Phil Steele) ... Former prep All-American ... Served on mission trip to Brazil during summer 2017 ... Earned his undergraduate degree in December 2018.

2019 (Senior): All-Big 12 honorable mention ... started all 14 games at SLB ... finished the season with 68 total tackles (44 solo), 9.5 TFL, 4.5 sacks, 1 forced fumble, 1 fumble recovery, 2 interceptions, 3 QB hurries, 2 pass break ups and 1 blocked kick ... collected 2 tackles (both solo) vs. Georgia in the Sugar Bowl (1/1) ... had 7 tackles (4 solo) vs. OU in the Big 12 title game (12/7) ... hauled in his second interception of the season and had 2 tackles at Kansas (11/30) ... collected 5 tackles (4 solo) and had 1 QB hurry vs. Texas (11/23) ... had 7 tackles (4 solo), along with 1.5 sacks for the second-straight game, tying a career high, also tied his career high with 2.0 TFL, had first forced fumble of his career and 1 QB hurry vs. Oklahoma (11/16) ... collected a career-high 11 tackles (8 solo) along with 1.5 sacks, 1.5 TFL at TCU (11/9) ... finished with 5 tackles (3 solo) with 1.0 TFL and 1 pass breakup and 1 fumble recovery, his first of the year vs. WVU (10/31) ... tallied 4 tackles (2 solo) with a half TFL at OSU (10/19) ... had a season-high 7 tackles with 1.5 TFL, a half sack and 1 QB hurry vs. Texas Tech (10/12) ... collected a season-high 7 tackles (5 solo), good for second-best on the team, along with 1.5 TFL, also a season-best at K-State (10/5) ... made three tackles against Iowa State (9/28) ... finished with a season-high 4 tackles (2 solo) at Rice (9/21) ... tallied his second career sack vs. UTSA (9/7), finished with 2 total tackles in the victory ... in the season opener vs. SFA (8/31), hauled in his second-career interception, collected 2 tackles (1 solo), a half TFL, 1 pass break up and blocked the first kick of his career, a punt in the first quarter.

2018 (Junior): Played at both linebacker and safety, appearing in all 13 games ... started 10 games total, including the final nine games of the season at SLB ... started at safety vs. UTSA ... Finished with 47 tackles (31 solo), 4.0 TFL, 1.5 sacks, 1 fumble recovery, 1 INT, 1 QB hurry and 1 pass breakup ... In his ninth start of the year vs. Vanderbilt (12/27/18), collected 5 solo tackles and a career-high 2.0 TFL, including 1.0 sack and recovered a fumble ... Collected his first-career interception vs. Texas Tech (11/24) that sealed the victory in the fourth quarter, also finished third on the team with 8 tackles (3 solo), a half TFL and 1 pass break up ... Against TCU (11/17), finished with 1 tackle ... At Iowa State (11/10), finishing with 3 tackles on the day ... Against OSU (11/3), making 7 tackles (1 solo), also was involved in his first-career sack, with a half sack for 2 yards ... Against West Virginia (10/25), made 3 tackles ... Had a career-day at Texas(10/13) with a career-high 10 tackles, 9 of those solo, another career-high, also had first-career TFL ... Against K-State had 3 tackles ( all solo) vs. K-State (10/6) ... Made his first start of the season at linebacker, making 1 tackle at Oklahoma (9/29) ... Made 1 tackle vs. Duke (9/15) ... Earned first start of the season at UTSA (9/8), making three solo tackles ... in his season debut, Lynch had 2 tackles (1 solo) vs. ACU (9/1).

2017 (Sophomore): Played in all 12 games with five starts (three at WR and two at CB) ... Had 15 tackles and four PBUs as CB and 17 catches for 269 yards with one TD as WR in 2017 ... Started at No. 10 TCU, caught four passes for career-high 110 yards and one TD for first 100-yard receiving game ... Started vs. Iowa State, had two catches for 21 yards ... Caught career-high seven passes for 77 yards vs. Texas Tech ... Started on offense at Kansas for first time since starting at RB vs. Kansas State on Nov. 19, 2016 ... Caught two passes for 10 yards at Kansas ... Had two catches for 51 yards vs. Texas ... Made one tackle vs. No. 23 West Virginia ... Had three tackles (all solo) and two PBUs at No. 14 Oklahoma State ... Started at Kansas State, had career-high-tying four tackles ... Played vs. No. 3 Oklahoma but did not record any stats ... Made first start on defense, posted two tackles and one PBU while also rushing oen time for loss of one yard at Duke ... Had four tackles and one PBU vs. UTSA ... Played first career collegiate game on defensive side of ball vs. Liberty, recording four tackles and two PBUs.

2016 (Redshirt Freshman): Played in 11 of 13 games with two starts at wide receiver and one start at running back ... Did not play vs. Boise State and at No. 13 West Virginia due to injury ... Had two rushes for five yards vs. Texas Tech before leaving with an injury ... Started first time at running back vs. Kansas State, rushed three times for 13 yards while making career-high-tying six catches for 63 yards and one touchdown ... Caught two passes for 21 yards at No. 9 Oklahoma and had first career rushing game with six carries for 58 yards ... Started, posted career-high-tying six catches for 48 yards vs. TCU ... Started, had two catches for 26 yards at Texas ... Made one catch for seven yards vs. Kansas ... Posted three catches for 80 yards at Iowa State ... Had one catch for seven yards vs. Oklahoma State ... Made first career start, had five catches for 26 yards at Rice ... Tallied six catches for 95 yards along with 31-yard TD catch vs. SMU ... Totaled two catches for 31 yards, including first career TD on 12-yard pass from Zach Smith in Baylor debut vs. Northwestern State ... Selected to Big 12 Commissioner's Honor Roll spring 2017.

2015 (Freshman): Redshirted true freshman season.

High School: National top 200 recruit from Gilmer (Texas) High School ... Versatile, All-American athlete rated nation's 86th-best recruit on 247Sports's Top247 ... Named 2015 U.S. Army All-American, chose not to play in 2015 U.S. Army All-American Bowl in San Antonio ... Ranked No. 185 overall prospect by ESPN ... National position rating: eighth by 247Sports (athlete), 21st by Rivals (WR), 25th by Scout (S) and 30th by EPSN (athlete) ... Runner-up for 2014 "Mr. Texas Football" by Dave Campbell's Texas Football ... Rankings among prospects in Texas: 15th by 247Sports, 15th on Dave Campbell Texas Football's Texas Top 150, 23rd on Austin American-Statesman's Fabulous 55, 27th by Rivals, 42nd on LoneStar Top 100, 46th by ESPN and 48th by Scout ... Named No. 2 "athlete" recruit in state by Dave Campbell's Texas Football 2015 winter publication ... Named MVP among QBs at 2013 APEC/ETSN combine ... State champion at Gilmer, led head coach Jeff Traylor's squad to perfect 16-0 season as senior in 2014 ... Named offensive MVP of 4A DII state championship game, totaled 117 yards on seven touches and scored twice in fourth quarter come-from-behind 35-25 win over West-Orange Stark ... Earned 2014 second-team Class 4A All-State honors as wide receiver after amassing 2,220 combined yards and 38 offensive TDs while playing running back, receiver, quarterback, safety and cornerback at GHS ... Totaled 1,043 yards and 16 TDs on 47 receptions, 888 yards and 19 TDs on 72 rushes (16.2 average yards-per-rush/reception), and 289 yards and three TDs on 13-of-17 passing ... Defensively, totaled 40 tackles, three interceptions, one fumble recovery and two defensive TDs ... Named 2014 first team All-Texas utility back and 4A DII Region I & II Player of Year (Dave Campbell's Texas Football) ... 2014 District 5-4A DII Co-MVP and first-team All-East Texas (ETSN) ... Transferred to Gilmer from Troup (Texas) High School, played quarterback as sophomore and junior under head coach Dennis Alexander at THS ... Totaled 750 yards and 11 TDs passing and 650 yards and 13 TDs rushing during injury-shortened junior season in 2013 (broken arm) ... Led Troup to 9-2 record and 2012 bi-district finals as sophomore ... Totaled more than 1,500 yards of total offense and earned 2012 District 9-2A Offensive Newcomer of the Year honors as sophomore ... Jumped and ran sprints for GHS track and field squad, member of 4x200m relay team that finished fifth at 2014 state meet ... Also played basketball, was 2013 District 18-2A Newcomer of Year as sophomore at Troup.
